page.title: 11HISTORICAL SITES-CALLANDER
page.content: Callander has been a tourist town for many years and has many historical sites. Overlooking Loch Vennacher is Dunmore where the remains of a Pictish {Hill {Fort}can be seen.The {Romans}camped further along the valley at Bochastle. At Kilmahog is Leny House,dating back to 1513,which featured in the{Jacobite {Rebellion}as an arms store and meeting place.Tte old toll house at Kilmahog is situated in such a way that travellers may be seen coming from all directions. St.Kessog is reputed to have preached from the mound,between the river and the old cemetery,known as Tomnachessaig.A popular walk is along the site of the old railway line,where evidence of its past use may still be seen.There was a Hydropathic.The owener's house is the old Coach House.
